cycloneMessage.issuingUnit: NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
cycloneMessage.systemGeoRefPt1: ABOUT 60 MI...95 KM NNW OF SOCORRO ISLAND
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP1 ALL TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM
BULLETIN Tropical Depression Eleven-E Advisory Number 5 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP112017 900 AM MDT Sat Aug 05 2017
...DEPRESSION MOVING AWAY FROM SOCORRO ISLAND... ...EXPECTED TO BECOME A REMNANT LOW LATER TODAY...
SUMMARY OF 900 AM MDT...1500 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...19.6N 111.3W ABOUT 60 MI...95 KM NNW OF SOCORRO ISLAND MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...35 MPH...55 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...NW OR 325 DEGREES AT 7 MPH...11 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1004 MB...29.65 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK ------------------------------ At 900 AM MDT (1500 UTC), the center of Tropical Depression Eleven-E was located near latitude 19.5 North, longitude 111.4 West. The depression is moving toward the northwest near 7 mph (11 km/h). A continued northwest motion with a decrease in forward speed is expected until the system dissipates early next week.
Maximum sustained winds are near 35 mph (55 km/h) with higher gusts. The depression is forecast to become a remnant low later today.
The estimated minimum central pressure is 1004 mb (29.65 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- None
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 300 PM MDT.
$$ Forecaster Zelinsky
NNNN
